intro: Uvariodendron angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved uvariodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
